intro: Xerospermum cylindrocarpum, commonly known as the cylinderfruit sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its compact, drought-tolerant growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink to purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Xerospermum cylindrocarpum is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
